Question:
Reminiscing about childhood experiences, a Middle Eastern man and an African American man were sharing stories that were both sad and touching. The Middle Eastern man recalled day-long fishing trips with his father and how, now that his father has passed away, he really misses those experiences of bonding. But the African American mentioned that because his father left him and his mom when he was only a year old, he ended up bonding with a neighbor, who would also take him fishing sometimes. Who was abandoned by their father? Answer with one of the following options: ('The African American man', 'The Middle Eastern man', 'Not enough information')
